file_content.text: I will not be sorry to leave this world behind.
You keep doing that.
I have saved your life. In return, I demand you turn over Moff Tyrak.
I have hunted this man for five years. Ever since his command saw my entire clan executed as traitors.
It was a lie! They served the Empire with honor! What did you seek to gain with their deaths?
Are you sure you've got the right guy?
He's hardly a mastermind.
Moff Tyrak. It was his command which authorized the execution.
Whatever the reason, it can't have been easy to lose your clan like that.
I'm sorry.
I am Mandalorian. That is all I have. Without my clan, I cannot claim even that.
Tell the truth.
Answer her, Moff!
It's not really ringing any bells. But my assistant handles most of that sort of paperwork....
But... but, why did you do it? Why conspire against them?
If I get an execution order, I always sign it. Better the wrong men dead than a traitor left alive, right?
This cannot be him! Where is the real Moff Tyrak? The sadistic Imperial puppet master?
In my experience, the world's a messy place. People die, usually with no good reason.
I'm afraid this is it.
This man couldn't conspire to get his boots on the right feet.
You've wasted your time.
Let me get this straight, you've dedicated your life to hunting down a guy who once signed a memo?
The joke's on you.
No. This can't be. My clan deserves vengeance. They must have their names cleared, the blood of their enemies used to purify their dishonorable deaths....
Revenge is always unsatisfying. Even if you succeed, you're left with nothing.
My family was killed, too. Somehow, you learn to live....
His ignorance is no excuse.
Killing him won't bring them back--but, no great loss, either.
Can we leave now? I have tickets to the Pa'lowick opera on Nar Shaddaa tonight.
No! I demand my blood rights!
Tyrak is a pawn. He brings the Republic what he knows, you'll have revenge against the entire Empire.
Let the Republic have him.
Let him go. With no one to protect him, his own stupidity should kill him off.
I'm washing my hands of this.
That is not the Mandalorian way, to leave his punishment to others.
We call it "poetic justice."
Give it a try.
You will not find any Mandalorian who sees poetry as justice.
Though to think of him tortured like my clansmen, dying as an Imperial traitor... that is appealing.
With Tyrak's intel, the Republic can hurt a lot more Imperials than you can kill yourself. Though you're off to a good start....
Let the Republic punish him.
If there was another responsible for the deaths of my clan, then it is him I should be hunting.
But perhaps it is a start. Perhaps he knows something that will let me track the true architect of my clan's betrayal.
I won't stand in your way.
Then take him.
I'm not buying the "I didn't realize murder is bad" excuse.
Take your revenge.
You are not who I imagined, and for that, I will show mercy.
He did not suffer.
I am not often at a loss for words, but I had not thought where to go once my search ended.
Are you looking for an extra gun?
I can't offer you a clan, but you have a place with me as long as you want it.
You're always welcome.
And I cannot give you my loyalty. But while I am with you, I will serve you well.
You come with me, you'll need to follow my orders. And stop killing people every time you need to talk.
My ship, my rules.
If I must.
I'm doing fine on my own.
No.
I am not asking to be friends. Nor would I require you to pay my fee.
After this, I serve no one but myself. There is no honor in working to serve someone else's ends.
But for food, a bunk and transport off Balmorra, I'll shoot anyone you need dead.
You know you're turning your back on ever working for the Empire....
You'll be fighting Imperials.
After this, there is no price great enough for them to buy my services.
How can I refuse an offer like that?
Come along.
Not quite, "I like you and want to spend more time together"--but if all you want is an empty bunk, it's yours.
[Flirt] Come with me.
First time you go against my orders, you're off. I don't care if we're in a Hutt's dungeon or lost in Wild Space.
I run a tight ship.
Agreed.
I will prove myself by returning this wretch to the Republic. If I refrain from killing him, you know you can trust me.
I did not forget my promise of a payment for bringing me the Moff. What would you have of me?
I'm sure you'll have plenty of chances to repay me if we're traveling together.
Don't worry about it.
Your generosity is... unexpected.
Just tell the Republic anything you know about the Empire. We'll call it even.
The Empire's plans.
As you like.
Hey! Hey, wait! Where are you going? Fine! Well, don't think you'll have Moff Tyrak to kick around anymore...
I will wait for you at your ship.
Get them!
Don't waste time.
Who are you, old man? What happened to the Mandalorian who was supposed to be in this cell?
What? He was executed this morning.
Executed....
I know this clan thing means a lot to you people.
I'm sorry.
I have no clan now. He was the last.
Guess the Empire really didn't like him, huh?
What did he do?
He lived with honor, and they killed him like a dog!
Ooh... Mandalorian on the warpath....
She's gonna blow!
You do what you need to; I owe you that much. But anyone you want out of here better be gone in five minutes.
Because I'm going to destroy this place.
Get the passcodes. They change them quickly.
Keep your head down. Security's tight inside the camp.
Do Mandalorians not learn how to say "hello"?
Good morning to you too.
"Su'cuy gar." It also means "I'm surprised you're still alive." Better?
Are you stalking me?
[Flirt] You again?
If I were stalking you, you'd be dead.
What are you doing here?
You again?
Trying to break someone out. Same as you.
The man who knows what you need is in there. Help me get him out.
I can get you to that Moff.
Perfect. When this is done, I will give any fee you choose.
I've scouted the cells here; security uses a two-man guard team as a precaution against corruption.
Neither one of us will be able to get in alone.
Great. Tell me the plan, and I'll see how I can ruin it.
You have a way in?
Does this have something to do with that Moff Tyrak?
Seriously, why are you here?
One of my clan members is imprisoned here. I'm going to free him.
Why should I trust you?
I will not tell you everything simply because we share a common goal.
Every patrol has an access code for one of two terminals needed to enter the prison.
You take out the patrols here and get their code. I'll get the other and meet you at the terminal.
I'll let you take the credit here. These aren't bodies I need on my name.
Is that Mandalorian armor, or am I just really behind current fashion trends?
Who are you?
I am Mandalorian. But that does not concern you.
Am I the only one here who's really confused?
What just happened?
Whose body were you looking for?
[Flirt] Oh, really?
Moff Tyrak.
Get me to him, and I'll pay any price you name.
Next time you want to talk, try a comlink.
Don't do that again.
Your desires are not the point.
I want access to Moff Tyrak, and I'll pay any price you name to get it.
You have no idea what I'm talking about, do you?
That sounds even more embarrassing when you say it.
Um... no.
You've got better access to Moffs than I do.
Can't you get him yourself?
You're the one sneaking around and leaving him gifts.
That's who your delivery is for: Imperial Moff Tyrak, commander of the Sixty-third Armored Infantry Division.
Guess the right number, and I'll see what I can do.
What kind of price?
I'm not looking to hire you.
I'm here because you're making secret deliveries from Bugtown to Moff Tyrak, Imperial commander of the Sixty-third Armored Infantry Division.
If he's working for the resistance, I want to know why.
Is this a very... creative Imperial plot to learn resistance secrets?
Why would I tell you?
If the Empire had ordered me to infiltrate the resistance, I would have started with someone who at least knows his own contact's name.
You're Mandalorian. Aren't you loyal to the Empire?
Aren't you Imperial?
No.
I am seeking Moff Tyrak for reasons of my own.
Let's get back to that "pay any price" part.
What are you offering?
I will give the Republic all I know of the Empire's plans here--as payment for Moff Tyrak.
I might be able to help you out for a favor like that.
Imperial plans, huh?
See what you can find out. I'll contact you later.
What if that's not the sort of thing I'm after?
[Flirt] I have another price.
I will give you the benefit of the doubt and assume you were asking for credits.
Ooh. I like her.
Harsh.
Haha.
Actually, I think he was suggesting that you'd... oh, I get it.
My money is gone, and all I have to trade is information. Think about it and contact me later.
I'm not giving up the resistance's secrets.
I'm not talking.
You don't even know what the secret is. Find out for yourself who you're leaving payments for and why.
You can contact me later if you decide on a price.
For now, I'm going to stay out of sight.
This is no place for civilians.
I believe you'd mentioned something about an Imperial armory in need of some liberating?
I want to line my pockets.
I will transmit the location.
If they're valuable enough, I'll track down any Moff you want.
Valuable armories?
Help me, and I can get you whatever you want on Balmorra--information on Imperial plans, or the location of their most valuable armories.
I will transmit to you the location of the best Imperial armory on Balmorra--as payment for Moff Tyrak.
A pile of money.
I prefer credits.
